key_points: The U.S. Senate is set to hold a second impeachment trial for former President Donald Trump, focusing on charges of 'incitement of insurrection'.
Nine House Democrats, all lawyers and new to the role of impeachment managers, will present the case against Trump.
The charge stems from the January 6 riot at the Capitol during the certification of the 2020 presidential election results.
Lead manager Rep. Jamie Raskin of Maryland decided to take on the role following the tragic death of his son and the Capitol riot.
Rep. Diana DeGette of Colorado has extensive experience in Congress and legal spheres, including civil rights.
Rep. David Cicilline of Rhode Island, a longtime Congress member, helped write the articles of impeachment.
Rep. Joaquin Castro of Texas, previously involved in Trump’s first impeachment, is noted for his legal and legislative experience.
Rep. Eric Swalwell of California, a former prosecutor, played a visible role during Trump's 2019 impeachment.
Rep. Stacey Plaskett of the US Virgin Islands is a non-voting member with a background in prosecution and law.
Due to Trump's non-presidential status, Chief Justice John Roberts will not preside, with Sen. Patrick Leahy stepping in, despite critiques.
spokespersons: Rep. Jamie Raskin (Lead House impeachment manager)
